_header: A king there was sometime and eke a queen
_description: ‘The Thre Priests of Peblis’ — in couplets

Asloan.First Lines:
A kyng þar was sum tyme & eke a queneAs mony In þe
                    land befor had bene…
Asloan.Last Lines:
…The questioun began for to declairThat is to saye quharfor It
                    Is & quhy…
Asloan.Note: 359 lines, ends imperfectly. Nineteenth-century transcription is Edinburgh,  Edinburgh University Library La.IV.27.
Asloan.Attributed Title:
Heir begynnis The tale of master Jhon of the thre questionis (f.
                    258)
Asloan.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Asloan Manuscript.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 14, 16. Edinburgh, London: Blackwood, 1923, 192: 2.175-86.
Robb,  Thomas Dunn,
                        ed.  
             The Thre Prestis of Peblis, how thai tald thar talis.
Scottish Text Society n.s
         8. Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1920.
